channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Four people killed, 40 injured in Russian strike on Ukraine's Dnipro, Kyiv says
item.description: Four people were killed and 40 wounded in a Russian missile attack on the eastern-central Ukrainian city of Dnipro on Monday, Ukrainian officials said. The attack came amid an intensified diplomatic push to end the nearly four-year war, with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy visiting Paris o

item.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy to visit Ireland on Tuesday, government says
item.description:
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will pay his first official visit to Ireland on Tuesday, the government said in a statement.
His engagements are expected to include a meeting with Prime Minister Micheal Martin and the inauguration of the Ireland-Ukraine Economic Forum, alongside Ir

item.title: Swiss voters reject proposed tax on super rich
item.description: Switzerland on Sunday overwhelmingly rejected a proposed 50 per cent tax on inherited fortunes of 50 million Swiss francs ($62 million) or more, with 78 per cent of votes against the plan, an outcome that even exceeded the two‑thirds opposition indicated in polls. Bankers have watched the vote clo

item.title: Ukraine hit two 'shadow fleet' tankers with drones in Black Sea, security official says
item.description: Ukraine hit two tankers used by Russia to export oil while skirting Western sanctions with marine drones in the Black Sea, an official from the SBU security service said on Saturday. The joint operation to hit the so-called 'shadow fleet' vessels was run by the SBU and Ukraine's navy, the official

item.title: Pope removes shoes but doesn't pray on visit to Istanbul's Blue Mosque
item.description: Pope Leo visited Istanbul's Blue Mosque on Saturday, removing his shoes in a sign of respect but not appearing to pray in his first visit as leader of the Catholic Church to a Muslim place of worship during his four-day visit to Turkey. The first US pope bowed slightly before entering the mosque a

item.title: Well-known faces to join the royals for Princess Kate's annual carol service
item.description: Actors Kate Winslet, Hannah Waddingham and Chiwetel Ejiofor will be among the stars joining the British royals for the annual Christmas carol service at London's Westminster Abbey hosted by Kate, the Princess of Wales, her office said on Saturday. The 'Together At Christmas' service, which will be

item.title: Zelensky's 'man for all seasons' ensnared in corruption probe
item.description: Ask Ukrainians who the country's most powerful figure is after the president and many will say Andriy Yermak, his chief of staff and a key negotiator during four years of war when Western financial and military aid has kept Kyiv in the fight. Yermak, a friend of President Volodymyr Zelensky and hi

item.title: British globe trekker faces changed world on final leg of 27-year journey
item.description: Karl Bushby, a British ex-paratrooper who set out in 1998 to walk around the world, is on the final stretch of his 27-year-long trek home, and trying to cope with social media pressure in a world that has changed profoundly. Walking in pouring rain in northwest Hungary, Bushby, 56, who started out

item.title: Russia says its proposals on New START arms treaty are intended to prevent negative global scenarios
item.description: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said on Wednesday that Moscow's proposals regarding the New START nuclear arms control treaty are designed to prevent negative global scenarios. Earlier, President Putin offered to voluntarily uphold the limits capping the size of the world's two larg

item.title: Paris court: Hearing on request for Shein's suspension in France postponed to Dec 5
item.description: The hearing on the French government's request that Chinese online platform Shein be suspended in France for three months over sales of childlike sex dolls and banned weapons, has been postponed to December 5, a Paris court said on Wednesday. Shein has already disabled its marketplace - where thir

item.title: French poll shows far-right leader Bardella winning presidential election
item.description: French pollster Odoxa predicted for the first time that 30-year-old far-right leader Jordan Bardella would win the next presidential election, scheduled in 2027, no matter who his opponents would be. The current president of far-right National Rally (RN) party, and heir to long-time leader Marine

item.title: BBC not ‘institutionally biased’: memo author
item.description: The author of a report that plunged the BBC into crisis said the broadcaster was not "institutionally biased", and he had hoped his criticisms would lead to improvements. Michael Prescott, a former editorial advisor, compiled a dossier on issues within BBC News, including failings in the editing o

item.title: Netanyahu's coalition skips parliamentary vote backing Trump's Gaza plan
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's governing coalition skipped a parliamentary vote on Wednesday endorsing US President Donald Trump's plan to end the two-year war in Gaza. The vote, proposed by opposition leader Yair Lapid, was largely symbolic as Netanyahu had already publicly backed th

item.title: Rafah crossing to open soon to let Gazans cross into Egypt, Israel says
item.description: Gaza's main gateway will open in the next few days, Israel said on Wednesday, allowing thousands of Palestinians who are in need of medical care to leave the war-ravaged enclave through Egypt. COGAT, the Israeli military arm that oversees humanitarian matters, said the opening of the Rafah crossin

item.title: If equality prevails, next UN chief will be a woman, says top contender Grynspan
item.description: Rebeca Grynspan, Costa Rica's former vice president and a frontrunner to become the next United Nations secretary-general, said that if equality triumphs over discrimination, the world body will finally see its first woman lead it. The process to elect the next UN chief formally kicked off last we

item.title: India's Congress seeks parliament debate on state-run app for smartphones
item.description: India's main opposition party said on Wednesday that a government plan to preload a state-run app on smartphones violates the privacy of users and the government needed to explain itself, escalating tensions on a matter that has sparked surveillance fears. The Indian government has confidentially

item.title: Trump invites Israel's Netanyahu to White House
White House defends US attack on boat from Venezuela as lawful
Trump says Venezuelan airspace should be considered closed
Four shot dead at birthday party in California
US State Department stops processing visas for Afghan allies
Mexico plans to build Latin America’s most powerful supercomputer
Showdown with Mexican billionaire Salinas tests Sheinbaum's power
Trump says he may cut income tax 'completely' because of tariff income
Trump administration to carry out sweeping immigration review after National Guard shooting
National Guard member dies as ambush in US capital becomes political flashpoint
Trump says US will soon take action against Venezuelan drug traffickers on land
US budget deficit hits $284b in October
Malaysia says search for flight MH370 to resume in Dec
item.description: The search for Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 will resume on December 30, the Transport Ministry said on Wednesday. Exploration firm Ocean Infinity will recommence seabed search operations intermittently for a total of 55 days, the ministry said in a statement. "The search will be carried out in

item.title: Seven terrorists killed in NW Pakistan
item.description: Seven terrorists were killed during intelligence-based operations in Pakistan's northwest Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province, the military said on Tuesday. The security forces conducted the operations in two different areas of the North Waziristan district of the province, the Inter-Services Public Relat

item.title: Imran Khan healthy but cut off in jail, sister says as family seeks access
item.description: Imran Khan, Pakistan's jailed former prime minister, is in good physical health but facing isolation and psychological strain, his sister said on Tuesday, after a rare supervised visit following weeks in which his family said access had been blocked. Uzma Khanum, one of Khan's three sisters, was t

item.title: Average life expectancy in China hits 79 years
item.description: China's average life expectancy reached 79 years in 2024, according to a report released Tuesday by the National Health Commission. China's 2024 health statistics bulletin highlighted continued improvements in both maternal and child health, with maternal deaths falling to 14.3 per 100,000 and inf

item.title: Hong Kong leader orders independent probe into fire that killed 151
item.description: Hong Kong's leader said on Tuesday an independent committee would be established to investigate the cause of the city's deadliest fire in decades, including oversight of renovations blamed for the disaster that has claimed 151 lives. Police have arrested 13 people for suspected manslaughter in a c

item.title: Australia house prices rise but growth slows in Sydney and Melbourne
item.description: Australian home prices jumped in November but gains in Sydney and Melbourne slowed, as expectations there would be no interest rate cuts anytime soon undermined sentiment in those already expensive markets, property consultant Cotality said on Monday. Home prices nationwide increased 1 per cent in

item.title: Euro zone factory activity contracts in November, job cuts accelerate, PMI shows
item.description: Euro zone manufacturing activity slipped back into contraction territory in November on weakening demand that forced firms to cut jobs at the quickest rate in seven months, a private survey showed. The HCOB Eurozone Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI), compiled by S&P Global, fell to 49

item.title: Sons of Pakistan's jailed Imran Khan voice fears for his safety
item.description:
The sons of Pakistan's jailed former prime minister Imran Khan fear authorities are concealing "something irreversible" about his condition after more than three weeks with no evidence that he is still alive, one of them said.
As court-ordered prison visits stay blocked&nbsp

item.title: Indonesia floods death toll rises to 442
item.description: The death toll from recent floods and landslides across three provinces on Indonesia's Sumatra Island has risen to 442, the National Disaster Management Agency (BNPB) said on Sunday. BNPB Chief Suharyanto said at a press briefing that North Sumatra recorded the highest number of casualties. "The n

item.title: Nepal announces $200,000 in financial aid to flood-hit Sri Lanka
item.description: The Nepali government has announced financial aid of 200,000 US dollars for Sri Lanka to support relief and recovery efforts for people badly affected by recent floods. Heavy rainfall and flooding triggered by Cyclone Ditwah in the past few days have resulted in the deaths of at least 334 people,

item.title: Mourners flock to site of deadly Hong Kong blaze as Beijing warns against protests
item.description: More than a thousand people turned out on Sunday to pay tribute to the victims of Hong Kong's deadliest fire in more than 75 years, as Beijing warned it would use a national security law to crack down on any "anti-China" protest in the wake of the blaze. The cause of the blaze at a high-rise apart

item.title: Netanyahu officially asks Israeli president for pardon
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has submitted an official request for his pardon to Israeli President Isaac Herzog, the Israeli president's office said on Sunday. "The Office of the President is aware that this is an extraordinary request which carries with it significant implications. A
